publicwhip.spmotion: * S2M-2881.1 Alex Neil:Support for the London Olympic 2012 Bid—As an amendment to motion (S2M-2881) in the name of Mr Frank McAveety, leave out from “that the legacy” to end and insert “, though, that Her Majesty’s Government’s current plans to finance the Games, should the bid be successful, place an undue financial burden on Scotland, with Scottish good causes and grassroots sport set to lose out on over £70 million of funding and fail to illustrate how Scotland will benefit culturally and economically if the bid is successful; disputes the value of the £50,000 to £60,000 of expenditure incurred by the Scottish Executive and its agencies on directly backing London’s bid; contends that these funds might be put to better use towards a Scottish bid to host the Commonwealth Games, and calls on the Executive to make clear to Her Majesty’s Government that its support for the London bid is contingent upon Scotland not losing out on any funding.”
